description:
Job Summary

The Planner/Scheduler is responsible for developing and maintaining production schedules and timelines to support a monthly shipment goal of 95% OTD or better.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: (But not limited to the following)

  • Creates and publishes production schedules to support monthly shipment commitments.
  • Handles all production planning and management of the ERP system, launching work orders to the shop, and rescheduling as needed,
  • Verify and manage raw material, hardware, multi-level production, and finished goods inventory. Communicate raw material shortages with the Purchasing Manager.
  • Manage the integrity of ERP production planning with the Production Control Manager.
  • Manage statuses of all launched work orders that are in production.
  • Update and present production and milestone charts in weekly line walks
  • Communicate with the Production Control Manager regarding order schedule changes, and delays.
  • Perform PO Contract Reviews in the production queue.
  • Communicate with the Sales Department regarding due dates, recovery dates, delays, or holds.
  • Collaborate with Engineering and Quality departments to move parts from MRP and resolve any holds. This may include coordinating the split of work orders and adding rework operations to work orders when necessary.
  • Manage the Work to Start Report to ensure that work orders are being launched on time.
  • Play a backup role in the shipping department with documentation and schedule of shipments. This includes assisting with Data Packs, Certification of Conformances, and accessing ASNs and Customer Portals.
  • Following the companies' policies, promote safety by working safely at all times.
  • Prepare various reports as required, including backlog reports, customer status, metrics, and update sheets.
  • Communicate with internal and external customers.
  • Performs other duties assigned.

Qualifications

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Minimum of 3 years of experience in production planning using an ERP system.
  • Aerospace experience preferred.
  • HS Diploma or equivalent required.
  • Higher education is preferred.

Skills & Abilities

  • Knowledge of MRP/ERP database applications
  • Strong communication skills required, both oral and written
  • Basic math skills required
  • Computer proficiency required
  • Proficient in Microsoft Suite
  • Intermediate or better in Excel preferred
  • Perform job with a minimum of supervision
  • Work within a team environment
  • Respond with sensitivity to people of diverse perspectives

Physical Demands

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit at a computer with dual monitors, keying alpha and numeric data for 50% of the time; will regularly use hands and fingers, handle, or feel; and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand and walk. The employee will occasionally lift and/or move up to 20 pounds unassisted and push light, bulky items on a rolling cart. The employee is required to be alert and use caution around moving material. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.

Work Environment

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally exposed to fumes or airborne particles and vibration. The noise level in the work environment is moderate.

We believe a workforce with diverse backgrounds and skills helps us realize our full potential. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, providing an inclusive workplace with growth opportunities for all employees. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual origin, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.
